snippet: The president of the association of Egyptian judges said that they were abandoning their neutrality in an effort to guard against an Islamist monopoly of power.
abstract: Ahmed el-Zend, the president of the association of Egyptian judges, says they are abandoning their neutrality toward the coming presidential runoff in an effort to guard against an Islamist monopoly of power; while he may not speak for all judges, Judge Zend appears to be giving voice to a panic that has seized much of Egypt’s old elite about the prospect of a president from the Muslim Brotherhood.
lead_paragraph: The president of the association of Egyptian judges said that they were abandoning their neutrality in an effort to guard against an Islamist monopoly of power.

headline.main: Egyptian Judge Speaks Against Islamist Victory Before Presidential Runoff
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Judge Speaks Against Islamist Victory Before Presidential Runoff
